front.title: Hardware-Rooted Attestation for Precision Time Protocol: Verifiable Residency and Proximity proofs

abstract.t: This document defines an extension to Precision Time Protocol (PTP) that provides per-event cryptographic attestation using non-exportable asymmetric keys resident in TPMs or HSMs, and an optional PTP-in-HTTPS/MTLS encapsulation mode. When combined with freshness and multi-observer correlation, this provides defensible proof of proximity for timing events. PTP-in-HTTPS/MTLS adds end-to-end confidentiality for timing payloads across untrusted fabrics.
